result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason K. Seaquist was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Hit and Run, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: DNA Proof of Submission

Case called: 10:03 a.m. 
Clerk: Heather.      
State appears by ADA Alex Lech; Defendant appears w/Atty David Casey;

Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.

State moves to;
CT 2>>DRI.
CT 3 (Hit and Run - Involve Injury)>>AMEND TO: Misdemeanor Hit and Run. 346.67(1) & 346.74(5)(a).
COURT grants above;
PLEA: 
CT 1 (OWI (2ND))>>GUILTY.
CT 3 (Hit and Run - Misdemeanor)>>GUILTY.

COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding; 
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made: a factual basis & defendant guilty;

COURT ORDERS: 
CT 1: 40 days in MCJ (Must report within 45 days) with huber privileges for work/school/treatment or a combination;  No objection to EMP.  Any vehicle titled or registered in the Defendant's name is subject to IID installation for 16 months. 16 months DL revocation with any administrative credit.  AODA (unless already completed).  6 points off DL; $400.00 fine plus CC and DNA surcharge; DNA sample; 1 day jail credit. 
CT 3: CC and DNA surcharge; DNA sample.

Adjourned: 10:19 a.m.
Final pre-trial on September 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.

of Preliminary Examination

records.addlTxt: Shall not drive a motor vehicle without valid driver's license.  Absolute sobriety from alcohol.  No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents.  Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202.  No contact with victim(s): M.L.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.

- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one week.

Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
